data.title: Shrout Tate Wilson Consulting Engineers
data.meta_description: The technical muscle is expected, but our team of consulting engineers is so much more. Meet the people behind Shrout Tate Wilson.
data.text:
Tyler joined our founding partner, Tom Shrout, in 2000 as the second-generation leadership of Shrout Tate Wilson. His management style is logical and deliberate – qualities he developed while in law school and engineering school. He is known in the business community for being a hands-on leader who stays connected with both employees and clients. His love for people and building professional relationships has guided STW’s steady growth for almost twenty years.

As a PE and an RCDD (Registered Communications Distribution Designer), his credentials underscore his abilities to design, implement, and integrate information technology and security systems. His organized workflow, commitment to STW’s clients, and his contribution to our best projects is noteworthy.

Tyler also serves as Principal over our Louisville office where he leads our projects for Brown Forman, Jefferson County Public Schools, and several community-centric projects including the renovation of the Fort Nelson Building into the Michter’s Visitor Center and the Wheelhouse Project for Boys & Girls Club.

Tyler is a member of the Rotary Club and served on the Lexington Board of Directors from 2008-2013. He and his wife Susan have three children. As a family, they value spending time together with summer weekends on the lake and winter break on the slopes.

Ralph Whitley is a firm principal and mechanical engineer. Prior to joining STW in 2010, Ralph worked in the design-build arena where he led HVAC design for manufacturing clients like Toyota Boshoku, Link Belt, FedEx, and Nestle. This work taught him how to bear-down and do hardcore estimating of mechanical and plumbing systems.

His spoken passion for complicated projects is complimented by his ability to think creatively and engineer functional, maintainable, and sustainable HVAC systems for owners. Ralph is highly detailed. He is known for defining project success early on and delivering on it every step of the way.

Ralph thinks creatively to engineer innovative strategies to achieve energy efficient systems cost effectively. He is the first engineer in Kentucky to design and install a Chilled Beam system. For STW, he designed our first ice storage system and is the engineer of record for two net zero-ready buildings.

He has a personal interest in historic, downtown buildings which is why his favorite STW projects incorporate adaptive re-use. His interests include sand volleyball and UK Football. In his community, Ralph is a member of Lexington Rotary Club and a 2016 graduate of Leadership Lexington.

After graduating from the University of Kentucky, Whitley’s first job was working for STW. Seven short years later, he became partner in 2010. As an engineer, a project manager, and now a leader, he is constantly raising the bar to make us stronger in every role. He keeps STW’s staff focused on quality and strengthening the fundamentals of good engineering.

Whitley’s prompt responses to clients and colleagues is hard to match. He leads STW’s team through some of our most challenging projects and doesn’t shy away from problems when they occur. He confidently pulls in the resources, solutions, and technical muscle required to get the project team back on track.

A native of Cynthiana, Whitley’s hometown roots are rich. Growing up amongst Kentucky’s most beautiful farmlands is a big reason why he always finds a way to be outdoors. Backpacking, skiing, kayaking, and hiking are when he is happiest and most relaxed. Whitley and his wife, Caroline, are college sweethearts and parents to their daughter, Anna Claire and son, Harrison.

Prior to joining STW in 2013, Nick managed the mechanical department for a large, full-service A/E firm. This experience gave him a different perspective of our architectural partners. He is always thinking about how we can better integrate into each firm’s unique project delivery method.

Within STW, Nick manages both the mechanical and distillation departments. He serves as PIC for a variety of clients in the spirits, education and public service industries. He is a key part of our growth in Louisville, Southern Indiana, Northern Kentucky and distilleries throughout the U.S.

People absolutely love working with Nick – whether as his client or employee. His patience, creativity, and ability to listen make him an incredible manager of his mechanical team and his projects.

A native of Pittsburgh, Nick graduated from the United States Merchant Marine Academy in Kings Point, NY. Aside from spending time and relaxing with his wife and kids, he enjoys riding his motorcycle, mountain biking, playing guitar and cheering on the Steelers.

James joined STW in 2017 to lead our Louisville office and was named Principal in October of 2019. As a graduate of Trinity High School and the University of Louisville SPEED school, James is a true Louisvillian. This local connection paired with his humility and sensible approach are why clients like having him onboard their projects.

His mixed background in consulting engineering and equipment sales explains why he is one of the most personable engineers you’ll meet. He’s polite, brainy, and humored by quirky one-liners. His career experience taught him that there can be many solutions to every problem. To find the right one, he applies his knack for listening to truly hear the expectations of the people and the project.

For our industry, James serves on the board for ASHRAE and is a past ACE mentor. At the office, you’ll find him playing his guitar and collaborating on better and different ways to manage. At home, his life is centered around spending time with his wife (and high school sweetheart) Ashlee, and their two sons, Evan and Cole.

Robbie joined STW in 2013 from Clotfelter/Samokar where he gained wonderful experience working closely with architectural, landscape, and civil consultants. This experience is why Robbie is solution-oriented, detailed, and precise. He is an excellent engineer and listener.

Working on projects for our K-12 and higher education owners are his favorite. He’s witnessed first-hand the impact a new or renovated building can have on students. When he sees the results in test scores, quality of education, and the overall student experience, it makes all the time, thought, and commitment well worth it.

Robbie is busy raising two girls with his wife, Molly. It’s that time in his life when it’s hard to fit in new things. That’s why his recurring New Year’s Resolution is to try or learn something new every year. So far that’s landed him on slopes, playing the piano, tasting peanut butter (he hated it), white water rafting, beginner woodworking, and fallando en mejorar su español.

Tom Shrout opened Shrout & Associates with his wife, Judy, in 1981. He spent many years working hard to develop the relationships and friendships STW has today. Every job was delivered under the principal of trust and integrity. His gracious and humble approach is still engrained in our staff today. We are reminded through Tom that it is an honor to work with and for our clients.

In his retirement, Tom is enjoying time with Judy, visiting grandchildren, and playing golf at every opportunity. Both Tom and Judy visit STW often. Our favorite moments with the Shrouts are at company events where they are always telling stories about our history. Our staff – both old and new – are reminded of our beginnings, the tradition of laughter, and the ongoing importance to treat all with kindness.

Michael joined STW as a construction administrator and enjoys working with Contractors, Owners and Designers as a coordinated team to ensure project success.

To see a project’s impact on the local surrounding community is what drives Michael’s passion for CA work. Michael enjoys meeting new faces and establishing long-lasting client relationships on any project he is a part of.

Communication and project management are Michael’s strong suits. His approachability coupled with his judicious nature ensure that all moving parts of a project are accounted for seamlessly. His favorite projects are Municipal ones due to their complex nature.

When not at work, Michael can be found playing video games or farming.

Micayla embarked on her journey with STW’s marketing department immediately after graduating from the University of Kentucky. As the dedicated Marketing Coordinator, she spearheads all marketing endeavors for the firm, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative strategies to the table.

Micayla’s contribution to the department is invaluable, as she possesses a diverse skill set and professional acumen. Her role is pivotal in shaping STW’s market presence and fostering meaningful connections with clients and stakeholders. This coupled with her approachability and ambitiousness ensures delivery of exceptional results which propel STW towards its strategic objectives.

Her passion for her job derives from her fulfillment in witnessing the positive impact that STW has on her hometown of Lexington, KY. Seeing the tangible benefits and transformations within the community reinforces her commitment to her role within the marketing department.

Outside of work, Micayla finds joy in nurturing her passions, including gardening, hiking, and spending time with family.

Austin joined the electrical STW team in 2021 after graduating from the University of Kentucky to assist our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

He is always trying to learn something new about both electrical and mechanical systems by asking questions about anything that he does not fully understand. He enjoys searching and finding the best solutions to problems that he comes across. He also enjoys helping the people around him and making people smile.

In his free time, Austin likes to ride his custom built and painted road bike around the Lexington area, hiking in the Red River Gorge, and trying new outdoor activities.

Daniel joined our team in 2023 and assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

Daniel’s approachability and convivial personality plays a key role in his ability to create long-lasting client relationships and forward-thinking solutions. His capability to listen to clients and unify thoughts promptly and effectively makes him a key member of any team he is a part of.

Following in his Grandfather’s and Father’s engineering footsteps, Daniel strives to make the community around him a better place through his work. His favorite projects include civic, K12 and sports/recreation.

As a former University of the Cumberlands Patriot football player, Daniel is a big fan of football and can be found watching UK, Bengals, or Reds games in his free time. Otherwise, he can be found golfing.

Carter joined our team in 2023 and assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Engineering is special to Carter because it combines two ways of thinking: practicality and creativity. Carter is passionate about using his brain to employ practical facts to create something new that improves the lives of people. He gets excited to wake up and serve the community around him day in and day out, and that is what makes the projects that give back to people his favorite projects.

Flexibility helps Carter contribute in a unique way to any team that he is a part of. Whether that flexibility has taken shape as serving in new ways at Church, learning something new on the farm, or working with STW. He loves viewing problems from a different angle to find a solution with the tools available.

Outside of normal work hours, Carter can be found spending time with his soon to be wife, Whitney. They might be going for a hike, buying groceries to cook a meal together, or playing HORSE at the park. One of the passions of his life is investing in the spiritual health of his friends. Other than spending time with people, Carter’s favorite hobby is fly fishing, so you might see him out in the Red River Gorge being a trout bum.

Christine joined the STW electrical team in 2022 and has over 25 years’ experience in the field of consulting engineering. Her strong suits include industrial facilities, healthcare, office buildings, higher education, k-12 schools and VA facilities.

Christine’s love for communicating with project owners and architects is what sets her apart from others. She enjoys making new client relationships and is able to effectively reach client goals and cultivate lifelong friendships with any owner/architect she comes across.

After working at a Consulting MEP Engineering firm after graduating High School, Christine enjoyed several years of drafting/design in this career field and decided to pursue her dream of earning an Engineering degree in 2000. Christine and her husband raised their two small children while she worked full time as an Electrical design/drafter and attended night classes at Miami University for ten years. Because of her passion and drive for engineering, she earned an Associate and Bachelor of Science in Engineering. She could not have completed this without her husband and family support.

In her free time, Christine can be found spending time with her six grandchildren and family, golfing, jogging or working in the yard.

Jason is an electrical designer with over 25 years of experience designing, supporting, and managing in roles with major manufacturing companies and professional service companies. His expertise spans over AC/DC low voltage, controls, and process automation.

His skill at utilizing general and technical specifications to produce construction deliverables for all types of in-line and off-line instrumentation and electrical systems is what sets him apart from others on his team. This paired with his easy-going demeanor and his intuitive nature is why clients request him on projects.

Jason’s interest in solving technical problems and troubleshooting compliments his passion for engineering. He also finds a deep sense of purpose in helping make the world a better place.

When not at work, Jason enjoys live music shows, cooking, and traveling with his children to UK football games or white-water rafting. He is also a Lexington native and Henry Clay Blue Devil Alumni.

Camden joined our team in 2022 and assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

With an interest in engineering since the age of 14, Camden displays a natural ability to problem solve on any project he is a part of. His approachable demeanor highlights his passion to understand projects at a granular level while creating new client relationships. His favorite projects are higher education, K12 and sports/recreation facilities.

In his free time, Camden can be found playing tennis, golf or basketball. If not playing sports, he can be found playing guitar or trumpet, as he is very musically inclined.

Nicknamed “Batman,” Josh’s organization and preparedness make him an asset to every project team. For every meeting, Josh thinks through the desired outcome and the role STW plays in getting there. This is also why Josh thinks through questions upfront and always has your project’s specs and drawings available for mark-up on his tablet.

The hard projects – whether a complicated renovation or a challenging mechanical system design – are his favorite. He likes doing the work that keeps him learning, asking better questions, and makes him a better designer for your next project.

Prior to joining STW in 2006, Josh worked at his family’s business, Gentry Mechanical System, as an Auto CADD technician. This is where he first developed his “whatever it takes attitude” and it’s been engrained in him ever since.

When he isn’t cleaning his car, he’s most happy playing with his dog (or yours!) and eating Sunday dinner with his family.

For our healthcare and K-12 projects, Brandon creatively engineers mechanical systems by implementing new technologies and energy saving strategies. Project teams notice his attention to detail, specifically his exceptional coordination with other disciplines.

As part of STW’s team since 2006, Brandon has learned how to communicate with our owners and architects. His responsiveness and easy-going personality elevate his projects. His clients and co-workers know that when they call Brandon, he will happily pick up the phone and take care of what they need.

Brandon and his wife Joni are both graduates of Tates Creek High School and the University of Kentucky. They are parents to three wild, wonderful girls whose personalities come alive on the mat. When Brandon isn’t at cheer practice or traveling to a cheer competition, he enjoys a moment of peace watching UK football with his male golden retriever, Campbell.

Connor joined our team in 2022 and assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Connor’s derived passion for engineering stems from an inquisitive mentality about how specialized yet broad his work can be. To see the impact of what his design efforts can bring to fruition on various project types is incredibly fulfilling for him. With his inherent interest in sustainability, Connor’s favorite projects include those with innovative designs that improve efficiency and propel the industry in a positive direction.

Seen as industrious by his teammates, he is quick to start conversation in order to effectively and promptly complete any project he is a part of. His adaptability and eagerness to learn allows him to cultivate creative solutions that make him essential to any team he is a part of.

When not at work, Connor thoroughly appreciates relaxing in a body of water, the lake being his number one choice. Connor also enjoys woodworking and is constantly seeking project requests from family and friends. Otherwise, he can be found skiing, hiking, mountain biking, or jumping into something new.

David joined our team in 2013 and designs electrical systems for commercial buildings including K-12 schools, office buildings, banks, churches, government and municipal buildings.

With over 22 years of experience, David not only demonstrates a broad depth of knowledge with various project types, but a capability of cultivating long-living client relationships. His attention to detail and analytical thinking makes him a crucial component of any team he is on. His prompt yet creative problem-solving skills ensure that all client’s projects are able to come to fruition while achieving their artistic vision.

Jeff is an electrical designer with over 35-years of experience designing energy efficient lighting systems, power distribution systems, voice/data networks, fire alarm systems, security systems, transient voltage surge suppression, and lightning protection systems.

He joined STW in 2014 following a merger with KTA Consulting Engineers where he served as principal and treasurer for 15 years. His previous roll as a firm owner influences how he approaches issues on projects. He is solution-oriented and resolves conflict with little cost or time added to the project.

Jeff’s excellent communication skills and easy-going personality are why his clients continue to request him on their projects. He makes sure our owners and architects are heard throughout the entire design and construction process.

Where Jeff also shines is with contractors. He has developed good relationships with the teams installing our systems to assure construction complies with his design intent.

In his personal time, Jeff is a drummer for Graveyard Romeos – a premier 80’s rock and metal cover band.

Billy joined STW in 2012 following nearly ten years with Green Mechanical Construction. For our diverse project portfolio, Billy designs plumbing and fire suppression systems that comply with LEED requirements and EPA’s Energy Star program.

Estimating is Billy’s strong-suit. His background in design-build keeps us focused on not just system design, but also its constructability.

Three things put Billy in his happy place – the country, panfish fishing, and eating breakfast. It’s why he and his wife, Melanie, moved to their farm in Mt. Vernon. This special place is also where he spends a lot of time (and energy!) playing Papaw to his three grandchildren, Devin, Destiny, and Natalie.

Jason’s first passion is helping people reach their physical goals every day as a Crossfit coach and Olympic Weightlifting coach. He grew up in rural Scott County on a working farm of approximately 1000 acres, thus culminating his love of the outdoors, conservation, and stewardship of natural resources.

Jason’s outdoor activities include, hunting, fly-fishing (and fly tying), backpacking, kayaking/canoeing, visiting the National Parks and traveling to other outdoor spaces. His other hobbies include martial arts, firearms training, wilderness survival, Japanese swordsmanship, woodworking, reading and writing. Jason and his wife, MaryAnn, moved into their log home in 2019 that they had spent the previous 13 months building. They did all the work themselves, in the woods of Casey County, Kentucky.

Xavier joined our team in 2021 and assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

His favorite projects are K12 due to his passion for learning and helping communities prosper. He also finds purpose in watching how his work directly impacts the community around him – especially students.

Xavier’s ability to listen and work collaboratively with clients allows him to effectively understand all aspects of projects he’s a part of. His innate motivation to gain a full understanding of projects enables him to cultivate innovative and creative solutions within the project’s scope.

In his free time, Xavier can be found watching sports, cooking or playing video games.

Paul is an Electrical Engineer with STW who assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

What Paul enjoys most about M/E/P consulting engineering is being able to make a positive impact on his community and helping others. Paul embraces that he is able to experience this impact both through design and physical project completion.

Problem solving is Paul’s strong suit. His open mindedness allows him to easily collaborate with project team members and make sure all options are considered in project design. His eagerness to learn affords him the ability to overcome any problem he’s faced with. His favorite projects are Sports & Recreation and Higher Education.

When not at work, Paul can be found at the gym, watching sports, golfing, or spending time with friends and family.

Since joining STW in 2013, Ashlyn has grown quickly into her current role of electrical project manager. For her projects, Ashlyn designs and specifies electrical systems, including energy efficient lighting and power distribution systems, emergency power systems, communication systems, and fire alarm systems.

Her development as an engineer is encouraged by her natural intuition to ask good questions. She is always seeking to learn more and understand the why within her designs. Her favorite part of every project is visiting jobsites, where she sees her work come to life during CA.

Ashlyn and her husband Matt (also an electrical engineer) carry on a family tradition to never visit the same place twice. Through her love of travel, she’s now visited 43 states and over 15 countries. In a single year, she has logged 8,972 miles visiting cultures across the globe!

Ethan Kelly initially joined our mechanical team in 2017, contributing his expertise to design and specify mechanical systems alongside our senior engineers and participated in Construction Administration. In 2024, he transitioned to our commissioning team.

His diligent and humble demeanor reflects his exceptional work ethic. Ethan is one of the most talked about young engineers amongst his colleagues. His pride for STW is admirable and his contributions to his project team are noticed.

Ethan likes small bass fishing on the forks of Elkorn Creek. It’s quiet there and the kind of place where he can travel down memory lane.

Prior to joining STW in 2014, Glen served as president for KTA, Inc. His leadership in tracking budget numbers are a valued asset to STW’s projects. Glen is a certified LEED AP with more than 35-years’ experience designing HVAC, plumbing, and fire protection systems.

Glen is one of the hardest workers you’ll ever meet. He is the anti-procrastinator and is known amongst his peers for getting it done – whether it’s his job or not. He is a wealth of knowledge for our staff, even serving as a resource for our most seasoned engineers.

Glen is a member of the Southside Church of Christ where he enjoys gospel singing and is the lead singer of a classic rock band with fellow church members. When he isn’t performing on stage, he’s sharing his time as a volunteer with Friendspeak – a reading program for international students to help them learn English. Glen also loves to play softball and golf whenever he gets the chance to play.

Connor began as an Electrical Intern and continued to join our team full-time in 2022 after graduation from the University of Kentucky. He assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

His affability is a key factor in his ability to collaborate and create new client relationships. His passion for providing a positive impact on his community reflects his dedication to all projects he is a part of.

As a proud Kentucky native, Connor’s favorite projects are bourbon distilleries. His innate enthusiasm for living in the bourbon state of America along with his enjoyment of the beverage highlight his interest in the growing industry.

As a long-time Disney fanatic, Connor enjoys being a Disney travel agent in his free time. When not creating Disney itineraries, Connor’s hobbies include wakeboarding, coffee, real estate and cooking.

Originally from Louisville, Shane graduated in May 2020 from the University of Louisville with a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering and earned his EIT certification in June of that same year.

STW is Shane’s first job coming out of college where he works alongside senior engineers to design mechanical systems. He has been working from very early in life, doing everything from hardwood flooring and bussing tables to performance contracting and catching bats. Shane has never been unwilling to give a job a try.

Shane is a devout Christian that enjoys hunting, fishing and spending time with his wife Sarah. Whether it be watersports on the majestic Ohio river or tumbling down a mountain on some skis, the two always seem to have a good time.

Dexter was born in Ft. Stewart, Georgia, but quickly moved seven times to follow his father’s career in the United States Army. He was impacted by living in Kentucky twice and it’s why he chose the University of Kentucky and Lexington as his home. This is also where he joined the Kentucky Army National Guard and served for six years, ultimately earning Sergeant in 2016.

For our electrical department, Dexter works in REVIT to design lighting, power distribution, voice/data networks, fire alarm, security, transient voltage surge suppression, and lightning protection systems. His favorite projects involve kitchen design where coordination challenges often exist.

The only thing you’ll ever hear Dexter brag about is his tennis shoe collection. With over 50 pairs of barely worn sneakers, he has a pair of Jordans or Nikes for every possible occasion.

Matthew is a Mechanical Engineer at STW who assists senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Matthew’s passion for engineering stems from his love for critical thinking and the satisfaction he gets from turning theories into practical solutions. He enjoys the challenge of designing systems and values the intellectual fulfillment that comes from problem-solving and applying concepts to real-world situations. Healthcare and distilleries are among his favorite project types, as they allow him to engage with complex and rewarding work.

What sets Matthew apart in a professional setting is his ability to blend careful listening with strong analytical skills. He approaches challenges with a calm and methodical mindset, which allows him to bring thoughtful solutions to the table.

In his free time, Matthew enjoys spending time with his wife, his dog Odin, and his family. When he’s not exploring the outdoors, Matthew spends his time reading about philosophy, mathematics, and physics.

Mayes joined the STW electrical team as an intern and shortly after went full-time in 2020 upon graduation at the University of Kentucky. Mayes assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

His drive and intuitive nature make him excel in solving difficult problems among his team. He is easy to talk to and provides thought-out insight to any business conversation, making him a key component to every team he is on.

Mayes’ passion for engineering derives from his dedication to understanding how things work. This encourages Mayes’ strong attention to detail qualities with any project he is working on. He is intrigued by the ever-advancing technology around us and is eager to learn more.

Mayes loves a challenge, whether it be at work or in his free time. During the past 2 years, he has picked up learning guitar alongside his Grandfather. His other hobbies include disc golf and hanging out with friends.

Caleb brings over 8 years of experience in mechanical engineering consulting, with project types ranging from offices, K12, and sports facilities to power plants, chemical refineries, and other industrial facilities. He is a professional engineer, licensed in Kentucky, Indiana, and Michigan.

His interest in engineering builds from an early involvement with large-scale, challenging projects and solving complex problems. An avid sports fan, Caleb would like to design more facilities related to sports/sporting events if it becomes feasible.

Caleb’s responsiveness, combined with his ability to identify and evaluate different design solutions, results in positive feedback from clients he is consulting. This, in conjunction with his attention to detail, are why clients are satisfied with his service and continually request him to be on their projects.

When not at work, Caleb can be found golfing, going to sporting events, and playing video games. Whenever possible, he loves to spend time in his hometown of Huntingburg, which is in the southern part of Indiana.

Caleb began as a Mechanical Intern and continued to join our team full-time in 2022. He assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Caleb’s analytical and intuitive nature highlights his favor in highly detailed projects. His enthusiasm for a challenge and expanding his skill set allows him to effectively cultivate creative solutions for any project he is a part of. His go-with-the-flow personality allows him to collaborate effectively with diverse teams from different backgrounds along with ensuring all client’s needs are met effectively and promptly.

Before getting his bachelor’s, Caleb was a full-time touring musician for 8 years. Because of this, he has visited over 48 states and almost 50 countries. On average, Caleb would play at 200+ shows a year.

In his free time, Caleb enjoys spending time with his wife and two pit bulls (Kevin & Bender), mountain biking, hiking and playing music with friends.

Brad joined STW following his graduation from the University of Kentucky. He assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems on our projects.

Brad likes his drawings the way he likes his work space – neat and organized. He works hard to perfect the details and tidy-up inconsistencies. His favorite part of working for such a diverse firm? He is constantly learning and building upon the mechanical strategies he’s implementing.

A daily listener to Kentucky Sports Radio, it’s no surprise Brad is a huge UK fan. In between football and basketball season, you’ll find him at local trivia night dominating the movie and pop-culture categories.

In 2006, Robin joined STW’s administrative team and quickly became Debbie’s partner-in-crime. Debbie and Robin are our queen bees who keep our office running like a well-oiled machine. Robin’s favorite part of her job, aside from working with one of her best friends, is creating better processes for our office and projects.

Her ability to prioritize and manage multiple activities is remarkable. She’s quick-witted, fair, and a wise sounding board for advice. Both professionally and personally, she is a tremendous asset to STW’s team.

Robin and her husband, James, live in charming Winchester, KY. At home, she beams in the roles of Grammy and sister. The time with her grandchildren is treasured and is only surpassed by any time she gets to spend with her four sisters.

James joined our electrical department in 2021, after 14 years as part of our CADD department. He uses his experience with CADD and BIM software to assist our senior electrical staff with design and the creation of construction documents. He focuses on consistency in his drawings and loves learning about the systems and processes that take place in the design process.

Prior to joining STW in 2006, James worked in the manufacturing industry doing inventory control and ISO coordination. In his 20’s, James worked in customer service at Lowe’s. It’s this early experience that gifted him the understanding of people’s desire to be heard. This valuable perspective helps James be a better communicator, coordinator, and team member on his projects.

James lives with his all-female family in Lexington – his wife Angie, daughters Sara and Alyson, dog Luna, and DD the cat. Although home is his favorite place to be, he does enjoy a little guy time riding throughout rural Kentucky on his Honda motorcycles.

Chris joined our mechanical department in January 2021 upon graduation from the University of Kentucky. He assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Chris’ charisma is a major factor in his ease of working with others and creating long-lasting client relationships. Looked at as dependable by others, Chris takes pride in his punctuality and is quick to start conversation within the group to problem-solve and bring thoughts together.

Designing structures that come to physical fruition that positively affect people’s lives is what gives Chris a sense of fulfillment within his job. “It’s cool to design structures, but even better to see them come to life.” Chris’ natural ambition is to help others, and this can be seen through his dedication to his work.

Chris recently got married to his wife, Taylor in August 2021. Together, they enjoy golfing and various other outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

For STW’s education, commercial and municipal clients, Brandon creatively engineers mechanical systems by implementing new technologies and energy savings strategies. His passion for design comes through when the client’s mission is integrated into their building. That’s why he strives to understand client’s objectives and takes care to involve the client in the development of straight-forward mechanical designs. While faith-based and community-focused projects are often his favorites, he has a heart for K-12 and Higher Education projects due to his wife’s career as an educator.

Brandon’s colleagues appreciate his positive attitude, patience and kindness. As part of STW’s team since graduating from UK in 2009, he has learned that first-rate responsiveness and collaboration are important to the success of any project.

Brandon and his wife, Sarah, live in Nicholasville with their young children, Emma and Abe. As a father, deacon, church worship leader and home DIYer, he enjoys working to make sure others are happy and well cared for. When all other work ceases, he can be found working on the family truck or picking at a new guitar riff.

Jim joined STW’s electrical department in 2014. He brings nearly 25 years of experience and a contracting background where he lived and breathed the fast-paced, budget-motivated, design-build environment. He is proficient in BIM and brings an added layer of expertise through his Master Electrician licensure.

Jim brings an unmatched attention to detail. His pride in creating accurate, clear, concise drawings is to provide better pricing, ease the installation process, and ultimately provide a better product to the owner.

At home, when Jim isn’t fixing, disassembling, or assembling something in his garage, he’s toying with the physics of magnets or rebuilding motorcycles.

Ben joined STW in February 2020 as a construction administrator and enjoys working with Contractors, Owners and Designers as a coordinated team to ensure project success.

After graduating from the University of Kentucky in 1995, Ben spent five years providing military master planning services for Air Force and Air National Guard bases across the US and Japan.

For the next 20 years, Ben provided Landscape Architectural marketing, design, management, and construction administration services for projects of all types and sizes including K-12, Higher Education, Industrial, Judicial Centers and Libraries. This experience demanded close coordination with all design disciplines and civic entities from project conception through construction. He now works with many of these same clients and continues to build on and create new relationships.

Ben and his wife Leslie celebrated 25 years of marriage in 2021 and have one daughter, Emily who is currently attending UK. All three have traveled extensively, including a notable adventure sailing a motorless 21’ Sea Pearl for a week, camping on uninhabited islands in the Exumas. Ben also enjoys trail riding and tinkering with dirt bikes.

Logan joined our mechanical department in 2018. She assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Conversation comes easy for Logan. This is one of the many reasons her colleagues and project team members enjoy her involvement on projects. She is also exceptionally organized and a subtle leader; two qualities that keep her developing and shining in her role.

Logan is a graduate of the University of Kentucky and an alumna of Tri Delta Fraternity. Her favorite moments are time spent with her parents and older brother or reading at the beach. A natural creative, Logan is very talented at lettering – a timeless art of creating hand-drawn letters.

Connor is a Mechanical Engineer at STW that assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

He has always had an irrefutable drive to figure out how things work. With thermodynamics being his favorite subject in school, he found great interest in mechanical engineering a result.

Connor takes great pride in thoroughly analyzing all of his project designs and not cutting corners. His favorite projects are ones that impact his local community. He finds purpose in being able to design innovative systems to help local communities flourish.

If he’s not with friends, Connor can be found with family, at the lake or going to UK games!

Chuck is responsible for plumbing and fire protection design utilizing Revit MEP and AutoCAD software. As a licensed plumber for over 25 years, Chuck is an expert in Kentucky’s plumbing codes.

His diverse project history includes K-12 and post-secondary educational facilities, state and local government, and non-profits. He also has a wealth of federal government and the Department of Defense experience through his work at GRW, Inc. and Mason & Hanger.

Chuck and his wife, Susan, live on a 15-acre working cattle farm in Wilmore. Along with his cows and calves, Chuck owns three miniature donkeys – Jack, Daisy May, and Jenny. For his community, Chuck has given 32 years of leadership and commitment to the Wilmore Lion’s Club and is a member of the Jessamine County Parks and Recreation Hall of Fame for his 18 years of service as a fast-pitch softball umpire.

Trent joined our team in December 2020 as Commissioning Authority, coinciding with STW’s strategic integration of commissioning into our service offerings. Motivated by an unwavering dedication to quality, Trent is often found on worksites, where he prefers to assess projects firsthand.

His expertise and hands-on approach distinguish him in the field, ensuring that all mechanical and electrical systems and assemblies are meticulously installed, tested, and are operating to meet and exceed client expectations. Trent’s ability to identify potential issues early and implement effective solutions is instrumental in ensuring seamless and reliable systems for various project types.

In his free time, Trent is an avid outdoor enthusiast. He enjoys the shooting, kayaking and biking. His passion for these activities reflects his love for challenge and precision, qualities that he brings to his professional role.

Tanner joined our team in 2022 and assists our senior mechanical staff with the design, specification, estimation, and construction administration of mechanical systems.

Tanner’s critical-thinking skills help him effectively solve problems for any project he is a part of. He is dedicated to helping others and always looks forward to working with new teammates so he can learn from them and acquire new skills.

His passion for engineering derives from a fascination with the process in which things are created. He also has an innate interest for the follow-through of ideas coming to tangible fruition.

When Tanner isn’t at work, he can be found spending time with his dog, Myka. He is also an avid South Carolina sports fan, so finding him at their sporting events is common.

Michael worked as a Test and Balance Engineer for 14 years before he discovered STW through a friend and started in February 2019 working as Construction Administrator.

Michael and his wonderful wife, Erin, have been married for 18 years and have 2 sons. He is an avid canoeist with a passion for the outdoors. One of his dreams is to travel the around the country in a travel trailer or RV.

Michael enjoys working in such a vibrant company. STW is growing and he is so happy to be a part of it. He loves getting to work with all the different personalities, the firm has a such a diverse group of high quality people.

Tanner joined the STW electrical team as a summer intern during 2018 and went full-time in January 2021. Tanner assists our senior electrical engineers with new designs and renovations of lighting systems, controls, power distribution, emergency power, communications and fire alarm systems.

Tanner’s personability is what sets him apart from others. He is quick to start conversation within his team to help advance projects and push problem-solving forward. He is also thorough when establishing long-time relationships with clients and ensuring all aspects of projects are performed to client’s standards.

Bourbon projects are Tanner’s favorite due to his inherent interest in the bourbon industry. His favorite bourbon is Woodford Reserve.

Tanner is proud to be a generational Electrical Engineer, following in the footsteps of his Grandfather and Father. He has always had a natural talent in math and science with an interest in the construction industry. He really enjoys being at the worksite to flex his hands-on troubleshooting abilities.

When Tanner is not at a job site, he can be found golfing, at the lake, at the beach or skiing.
